title: SmartGold01
author: SmartGold01
content: Good evening allI don't know how you people are feeling for me to report this here or it does not reach up to the level of making this thread but some how it has been fake results or do I call it fake counts on merits records.For some days or weeks now I have been seeing merits notification on the bots giving me inaccurate scores, for instance my merits profile is 508 but the telegram notification bot is giving me 509 this made me started wondering if actually my merits got missing but when I looked at my bitcointalk profile I noticed it was common error from the bot. This is to show that those that are using bot for trading are into big risk because one day they might fall into trouble of their bot having a technical issues causing it to malfunction and this could lead for a total damage and lost for the trader.For beginners I will encourage you do not rely on bot for trading because this shows me as a lessen not to put hope on a bot for trading or for anything else as they might malfunction at any time causing a huge lost whereby you would lived to regret it. Please is there any thing I could do to reflect to my current merits count now, currently now I am having 508 on my profile and I would like the next toping of my merits to corelate with the current instead of giving me higher figure than my current merit counts.The image below shows what I meantThank you all.Please do not be mad at me for creating this topic.

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Lol, what?What does this bot have to do with trading?Maybe check its official topic?Maybe even read it, since people have been mentioning the duplicated merit notifications for weeks?Why is this even a topic?EVERY software can have bugs, this is not exclusive to "telegram bots".[TELEGRAM] Yet Another BitcoinTalk Notification BOT (merits, mentions, topics,+)So many questions...

comments.author: Crypto Library
comments.body: I think this quote can useful -_-Quote from: logfiles on July 19, 2023, 10:15:33 PMQuote from: Crypto Library on July 19, 2023, 09:19:24 PMIs anything wrong with my telegram bot? Or am I unaware of any event? It seems the total merit number is different on the bot from the forum numbers. 576merits on bot and 575merits on Forum. Forum:Bot:It sometimes happens, but there is a solution.In the message box of the notification bot, try entering this and hit sendCode:/set merit 576for youCode:/set merit 508

comments.author: DVlog
comments.body: This bot was developed by TryNinja and here is the official post regarding this bot. This bot is not forum made and can be called community developed bot so it will be better to inform the creator of this bot. I am not sure if he is still developing this bot or not but he is the one who will be able to fix the bot. I think this is a minor issue with the telegram API. [TELEGRAM] Yet Another BitcoinTalk Notification BOT (merits, mentions, topics,+)

comments.author: Clark Anderson
comments.body: I guess it might be an error which is common which most telegram bots. But this is nothing to worry about. I only noticed that I couldn't receive some notifications today on my telegram bot. But maybe it was a cause of bad network. As regards your issue, I would advice you to reset or rather delete your bot and add it up again as a fresh start. This might help solve your issue.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: I think there was a glitch a few days ago, which I noticed on the 27th of this month, where a previous merit notification I received from someone on a particular thread had the same amount of merit. The notification was repeated the next day, adding an additional number to my merit count, but when I checked my profile, that merit did not reflect, and when I clicked on the link, it took me to the old merit that I received. That was the only time I noticed this, and after this exact error occurred, I have not seen anyone of such again. But this one error has affected the whole merit counting because that one that happened has been recorded on the system, and the system has your total number of merits counted, so when you receive a new merit, it will immediately be counted upon from the previous number, which was the last record on the bot. I think this post is best to be reported under the btt bot thread and not meta, as it has nothing directly to do with the forum in particular.

comments.author: Chilwell
comments.body: This am seeing is surprising me because even today someone merit me and it gives me exact figure, as I saw this thread I even went back to check my mine again to see whether mine is also misbehaving but my result is OK. I assume it can be an error from the bot, let just say the mistake is from the bot, we should not say bot is bot not human but it's human being that makes the bot, so mistakes can come also from the bot too.

That could cost millions of dollars, and developers need to be held accountable.I like your expression when reviewing this, haha...It was just a simple example I sets maybe trading bot might not be as same as this one, but who knows I have never used a trading bot before so only those who had used it could be able to give a full expression towards having facing same issues.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: SmartGold01 on September 30, 2023, 08:30:55 PM~It was just a simple example I sets maybe trading bot might not be as same as this one, but who knows I have never used a trading bot before so only those who had used it could be able to give a full expression towards having facing same issues.Oh, for heaven's sake! So you have never even used any of the trading bots, but you've got this hunch that this Bitcointalk notification bot might be connected to them somehow? Well, isn't that cute! You know what they say about meddling with things you don't understand, right?How about you stop installing scripts and running bots you know nothing about? Otherwise, you might be back here tomorrow, crying about how your MetaMask wallet got "hacked" because, oops, you accidentally clicked where you shouldn't have and approved something you absolutely shouldn't have. Let us avoid that, shall we?
